sentences.english: Khomeini’s regime responded with remarkable brutality, slaughtering thousands of the organization’s members.
sentences.chinese: 霍梅尼政權殘忍的鎮壓遊行，屠殺了幾千名組織成員。

sentences.english: Lightsabers have changed little in the thousands of years of their employ by the Jedi Knights.
sentences.chinese: 在絕地武士使用光劍的幾千年裏，光劍的變化不大。

sentences.english: Actually, Chinese history of literature is the musical literary history .
sentences.chinese: 歷數中國幾千年文學史，其實是一部音樂文學史。

sentences.english: The earth has been warming for thousands of years.
sentences.chinese: 幾千年來地球都在不斷增溫。

sentences.english: Some sports or games go back thousands of years, like running or jumping.
sentences.chinese: 有些運動或運動會追溯到幾千年，如跑步或跳躍。

sentences.english: they grazed their cattle over thousands of acres of public domain.
sentences.chinese: 他們在幾千英畝的公共區域放牧。

sentences.english: No one can stop what our fathers and forefathers have done for thousands of years.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人能夠阻止我們父親和祖先在幾千年前所做的。

sentences.english: Now, having earned thousands of yuan, he is optimistic about the future.
sentences.chinese: 現在，在已經收入了幾千元後，他對未來很樂觀。

sentences.english: Now, you can buy a pentium IV for only several thousand yuan.
sentences.chinese: 現在你只需要花幾千元就能買到奔騰IV了。

sentences.english: Several thousand supporters strained to catch a glimpse of the new president.
sentences.chinese: 幾千名支持者翹首企盼能一睹新總統的風采。

sentences.english: It's an ancient land that hasn't been changed much over the millennia.
sentences.chinese: 它是個過了幾千年古陸都沒怎麼被改變過的國家。

sentences.english: This gold whites well, seems to be better than thousands of a pair.
sentences.chinese: 這對金眼白不錯，好像是要好幾千一對。

sentences.english: Governments have spied on each other for thousands of years.
sentences.chinese: 各國相互祕密偵察的做法已經有幾千年的歷史了。

sentences.english: Who knows what might be under the thousands of acres that are left?
sentences.chinese: 誰知道在剩下的幾千英畝下還會有些什麼？

sentences.english: They waited for thousands of years of Bian Hua, but have never met.
sentences.chinese: 他們守候了幾千年的彼岸花，可是從來沒有見過面。

sentences.english: This is in marked contrast to the few thousand degrees of a conventional explosion.
sentences.chinese: 這和普通爆炸所造成的幾千度相比是令人震驚的。

definition: to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
at the minimum/at the very least
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
